column5: How about a #5 shad rap/ very durable and will feed a family of 4, by trolling some shorelines in short order.
1/4 oz beetle spin. White or black.
A slip bobber with a leech

Our group likes to slow troll rigs and years ago concluded we did best with a simple 3 - 4' snell, number 2 colored hook dressed with a single bead. I've got a tackle box full of spinners that I occassionaly will try but always go back to the single hook snell.Now, having said that, the original question was "what ONE lure?" and if I was forced to that I'd choose a 3/8 oz, round, pink jig. Jigs can be used for all species, trolled or still fished, work in all seasons and dressed with almost anything. About as "all around" a bait as you can find.
Depends on the Lake I am fishing Go to seems to be a bright colored jig with a twister tail. Close second would be a harness with a nightcrawler
Or the green #4 Gamakatsu hook with a red bead! The long leader is the ticket to success! I like to use less weight depending on the chop or current. Let the Games begin!
I perfer a chartruse 1/8 ounce jig with either a minnow or half a crawler.If it's for a musky trip big blue and silver cowgirl
3/8 oz fluorescent orange jig w/ 4" chartreuse curly tail tip w/ leach...
Either a road runner or one I call the Miracle.KT
#3 yellow lazy ike with red dots, catches everything.
If I'm fishing for survival and have to feed the family I would I would definately bring the following:3 rocksrope3 sticks of D*namite
Jig w/twister tail and a minnow preferrably the dace minnow with the red stripe.
I agree 1000% with Wallydave. I would also take a white twister tail for when I loose the minnow LOL. Have a great yearThank you,Larry Mac

This has been a fun post so far. Interesting to see what your favorites are. A few more posts and I will head to bass pro and pick up a few of each. {Devilish Laugh} Just kidding... I think I have most of these already. I will have to give some of your favorites a try. I think sometimes we fisherman get tunnel visioned into one or two lures/baits (because either we caught our largest fish on it or had a best numbers day) so we use that one lure 99% of the time and the rest of them just sit there in our tackle boxes only to be wetted for a mere 6 or seven attempts and then tossed back into the tackle box. Leaving with my 12 year old son for Lac Seul in 14 more sleeps. Can't wait! 4th year in a row for him now!
1/4 oz white jig, nightcrawler
Mac's smile blade 3/4" in gold with beads and foam float behind a 1 oz. sliding bottom bouncer.
Klass Walleye Catcher, steel line spinner with a hammered nickle blade behind a 3/8 bead chain weight. Add some meat or a twister tail and your in business.
for stained water- chartruese round jighead with a chartruese(silver flake) 4" ringworm for clear water- orange round jighead with a brown body(red flake) chartruese tail 4" ringworm
Agree 100%. Especially if the jig and twister tail are both white.
Parrot colored jig, red stripe dace and invisibraid on my new jig rod. All you walleyes, you have been duly warned. 1 week to takeoff!
x2 . . . . with the chenille body, the fluffy tail trimmed to not extend past the bend of the hook, and 1/2 a crawler added!!
Ok GentsYour family is depending on your fishing skills to survive. You have only one lure/bait to choose from. What is it?1/4 oz pink round headed jig, fire tiger skirt tipped with a small minnow.
#4 red Gamakutsu hook,Chartruese bead.4 ft leader and a 1 1/2 oz. bottombouncer,1/2 a crawler or a leech or a minnow.Get the net!!!!!
Couple split shot, #4 hook and a leech.Pooch
3/8 oz knuckelball zone -r jig Firetiger color trigger-X minnow and a crawler, if not that Firetiger worm harness with 1 1/2 oz bottom bouncer and nightcrawler
1,8 ounce road runner jig head. Yellow!!
A special jig that I tie myself, white with silver or gold mylar. Bill
Bomber Long A, Gold and Black.(I love the way the question was framed!)
Hammered gold spinner, bottom bouncer and minnow.
I also choose a 1/4 or less round pink jig
If I only had to go with one it would a pink jig and a shinner minnow! Both my biggest walleye and pike were on a jig and minnow! The pike was on an ultra lite too!!
